title: Strong Mac,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: That was Ebie Cargen and his prentice at it not too hardly, for it was the deadest summer season and work not plentiful.

title: Strong Mac,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: Ebie Cargen had put out his smiddy fire, and was sitting in the kitchen over his supper when the young man paused on the green brow of the knoll above.

title: Strong Mac,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: "And what micht be your Honour's will wi' Ebie Cargen  the nicht ?" he said.

title: Strong Mac,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: "If he wants Ebie Cargen, he can come and seek him.

title: Strong Mac,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: "Come ye ben here gin ye want ocht wi' Ebie Cargen !" said the smith, and forthwith betook him back to his anvil.

title: Strong Mac,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: A loud voice hailed the smith by name, and Ebie Cargen went to the door to answer.

title: Strong Mac,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: It came to pass at the smithy of Ebie Cargen, the village antiquary and political dictator of the parish.
